title: Learning-Based Approach for Learning Object Evaluation

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design theories and experience in educational content planning
context.additional_context: Development and application of assessment tools optimized for smartphone-based mobile learning

learning_goals: Learners can explain reliability and validity verification methods for measuring the educational effectiveness of learning objects.
Learners can design learning-based assessment tools that integrate formative and summative evaluations.

Learners develop a learning object evaluation framework executable in smartphone environments (e.g., 5 core metrics: mobile UX evaluation, content accessibility, interaction efficiency) and derive evaluation results with over 80% reliability by applying it to at least 3 real learning objects.

Learners analyze correlations between 3+ instructional design elements (interactivity, feedback mechanisms) and learning outcomes (test scores, assignment completion) via statistical analysis (correlation coefficients, p-value verification) over 1â€“6 months and write an APA-formatted research report.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
